thread.title: Double disaster for Nissan at Bathurst
thread.title_full: Double disaster for Nissan at Bathurst

title: Double disaster for Nissan at Bathurst
text:
Bathurst 12 Hour: Audi tops Practice 5 as second disaster hits Nissan Will Dale, FOX SPORTS February 4, 2017 9:52am 
JUST as Nissan finish one all-night repair job, a crash in Practice 5 leaves them in a race against time to repair their other car for Bathurst 12 Hour qualifying. 
Katsumasa Chiyo brushed the wall on the run down to the Dipper with just 10 minutes remaining in Saturday’s final practice session, badly damaging the right front corner of the No. 23 Nissan GT-R NISMO GT3. 
Chiyo-san did a remarkable job of keeping the car out of the wall of the left-hand side of the track, bringing the car to a stop on the exit of the Dipper. A leading contender in wall! Disaster for @KATSUMASA_CHIYO #B12hr pic.twitter.com/zR1jZqcmHm — Bathurst 12 Hour (@Bathurst12hour) February 3, 2017 
The driver was okay — punching the wheel in frustration — but the car was not. 
“I was too close to the inside wall,” Chiyo explained. 
“I thought it might just be a scratch but the tyre angle caused the damage. The tyre gripped on the wall. That pushed everything, the suspension on the left front.” — Bathurst 12 Hour (@Bathurst12hour) February 3, 2017 
The broken car was brought back down to the paddock on a flat-bed truck, spending several minutes in the Parc Ferme area as the Nissan crew worked to get cradles under the car to push it back to the garage. 
The crash came just 20 minutes after Nissan completed an overnight rebuild on their No. 24 car after Florian Strauss crashed during Practice 3 on Friday. 
Although there is less damage to the No. 23 car, the team is still up against it to get the car ready for qualifying later on Saturday. #23 making its way back to the garage. Chiyo-San helping push. #B12hr pic.twitter.com/0MMfZi45G3 — Will Dale (@WillDale956) February 3, 2017 
“The damage was bigger than I expected. Immediately I try to stop the car and bring the car back, because we have limited time to qually. 
“I hope we can fix the car before qually. We try our best.” 
The first of the two qualifying sessions gets underway at 10:40am AEDT — about 85 minutes after the damaged Nissan arrived in the team’s garage. 
However, the No. 23 car doesn’t need to be ready until as late as 11:50am, when the second qualifying session exclusively for Class A cars gets underway. 
Chiyo’s crash, which, ended the session prematurely, was the second major crash of the one-hour session. 
The No. 62 R-Motorsport Aston Martin crashed heavily on the run up Mountain Straight. 
Jan Struve was at the wheel when the car veered right just after crossing the hump in the straight, slamming heavily into the wall before sliding to rest on the left side of the circuit. 
The car was badly damaged along the left side and is in doubt for qualifying, if not the race as well. — Bathurst 12 Hour (@Bathurst12hour) February 3, 2017 
The truncated session was topped by the No. 75 Audi of Garth Tander/Christopher Mies/Christopher Haase, ahead of the No. 11 McLaren and No. 60 BMW. 
The No. 23 Nissan was fourth fastest despite Chiyo’s crash, while the No. 74 Audi rounded out the top three. 
RESULTS — Practice 5, Bathurst 12 Hour (60 min) 1. (75) G Tander/Mies/Haase (Audi) 2m03.500s2. (11) Walls/Luff/Slade/A Davison (McLaren) +0.364s3. (60) Richards/Winterbottom/Wittmann (BMW) +0.579s4. (23) Chiyo/Buncombe/Caruso (Nissan) +0.615s5. (74) Winkelhock/Frijns/Stippler (Audi) +0.639s6. (8) Soucek/Soulet/Abril (Bentley) +1.089s7. (7) Longhurst/Skaife/Ingall/Glock (BMW) +1.104s8. (911) Bamber/Estre/Vanthoor (Porsche) +1.203s9. (22) Van Gisbergen/Baird/Engel (Mercedes) +1.491s10. (32) Lago/Owen/Russell (Lamborghini) +1.549s
